sourcing.instructions: Cs (Cesium) - Purchase from a chemical supply company; In (Indium) - Obtain from a metal supplier; Sc (Scandium) - Available from specialty metal distributors; Te (Tellurium) - Source from a chemical supplier or online marketplaces for rare elements.
steps: Cs (Cesium) - Purchase from a chemical supply company; In (Indium) - Obtain from a metal supplier; Sc (Scandium) - Available from specialty metal distributors; Te (Tellurium) - Source from a chemical supplier or online marketplaces for rare elements.

1. Weigh out 12.0 g of Cs, 2.0 g of In, 2.0 g of Sc, and 12.0 g of Te using an analytical balance. 2. Place all materials into a clean, dry ceramic or glass mixing bowl. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to thoroughly mix the powdered materials until a homogeneous mixture is achieved. 4. Transfer the mixture into a small crucible for heating.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out 12.0 g of Cs, 2.0 g of In, 2.0 g of Sc, and 12.0 g of Te using an analytical balance. 2. Place all materials into a clean, dry ceramic or glass mixing bowl. 3. Use a mortar and pestle to thoroughly mix the powdered materials until a homogeneous mixture is achieved. 4. Transfer the mixture into a small crucible for heating.

steps: 1. Preheat a furnace to 800°C. 2. Place the crucible containing the mixed materials into the furnace. 3. Maintain the temperature at 800°C for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and formation of the compound.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a furnace to 800°C. 2. Place the crucible containing the mixed materials into the furnace. 3. Maintain the temperature at 800°C for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and formation of the compound.

steps: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature. 2. Do not open the furnace door until the temperature has dropped below 200°C to prevent rapid cooling or contamination.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature. 2. Do not open the furnace door until the temperature has dropped below 200°C to prevent rapid cooling or contamination.

steps: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the crucible from the furnace. 2. Allow the sample to cool to room temperature on a heat-resistant surface. 3. If necessary, use a diamond file or sandpaper to smooth the surface of the sample. 4. Optionally, coat the surface with a sealant for protection against oxidation.
